artwork.description: Website designed from scratch in PHP5 using a MySQL5 database and, of course, XHTML and CSS. There are essentially three different pages: index, gallery, and picture, that display information pulled from the database. Sounds so simple when put like that.  To do this I used Eclipse, Firefox with the firebug extention, and a command line MySQL shell.
artwork.name: My Website

artwork.description: The website you see here! I took a photoshop template (which you can find here), adapted it for my purpose, and created a fully functioning, interactive, professional online portfolio with HTML5 CSS3 JavaScript and JQuery
artwork.name: Personal Portfolio

gallery.description:
I have been working increasingly with digital media since it is much more convenient to move around with it, and I don't have to worry about getting paint on the carpet. It would be nice if I had a more powerful computer though.

I work primarily with PhotoShop, but am gradually moving towards the GIMP since it is free, and although it lacks some of the features of PhotoShop, I think it will be fine once I've got used to it.

I use a Wacom Bamboo graphics tablet, but some of my older work was done using a Trust tablet and even a mouse.
gallery.name: Digital Paintings

gallery.description:
These animal pictures are created using your ordinary biro or ballpoint pen. I started the series in 2005, and have recently done many more works as I have discovered coloured pens.

I also find this medium very convenient as it isn't messy, and biros are easy to carry or find lying around while I have moved from place to place. I prefer it to pencil as it produces a much more dramatic and crisp image. Even though there's no erasing mistakes, there are very few images that I have discarded.

I work from a photo, and build up from faint shading, continually darkening it, constantly adjusting for errors. This way the shapes gradually take form, and old errors are hidden by new shading as I darken the picture. They usually take me 2-4 hours to produce.
gallery.name: Pen Animal Series

gallery.description:
I have worked in a wide variety of mediums including acrylic paint, pastel, pencil, watercolour and pen. My favourites have to be acrylic paint and oil pastel.

I've done less traditional work recently for lack of space. But now I have a garden, so I hope to set up my easel there and get some painting done, if weather permits.
gallery.name: Traditional Artwork

gallery.description:
Some of my less refined work. Here you can see where my ideas start.

When coming up with a new idea I like to make a few quick sketches until I know what I want, then do a quick speedpaint to get the general look I'm after. Some of them progress to be finished works of art, others remain here until I decide I want to take them further

There are also some quick studies from photos and life for practice
gallery.name: Sketches and Concepts

gallery.description: Thanks to a recommendation from Weevil The Cambridge University Scientific Society asked me to design the posters to advertise the talks they organise. I was more than happy to oblige
gallery.name: SciSoc Posters

gallery.description: Weevil Magazine was begun by my friend at Cambridge University. It is a magzine based on the principles of the Ig Nobel: Research that makes you laugh, and then think. I was only too happy to offer my talents to design the background images for their magazine coveres
gallery.name: Weevil Magazine Covers

gallery.description:
After graduating from university I got a part time job working for a small parish council: Orchard Park Community Council which was newly formed for a new housing development to the north of Cambridge

Because they were so new, they didn't yet have an image, and so I was able to take a leading role in it, designing their website, promotional material, and even their logo
gallery.name: Orchard Park CC

gallery.description: A collection of logos I have designed. I'd like to do more of these, and maybe look into typography
gallery.name: Logo Design

gallery.description:
Web design is an area I am very interested in, as I think it brings together art and technology. I am considering going on a Masters course for it.

The websites I've done so far have given me experience with XHTML, CSS, MySQL, PHP, Django (Python), and Joomla!
gallery.name: Web Design

gallery.description: Here you can see the process I go through when creating some of my images, with some of the thought process explained. Each of my pictures is a new experiment, and I hope you can benefit from my lessons learnt.
gallery.name: Walk Throughs

gallery.description:
The Cambridge Rock Society is a society dedicated to promotion rock, metal and alternative music in Cambridge.

When I joined Cambridge University, rocksoc quickly became my family as I found kindred spirits. I was happy to contribute where I could, and was Webmaster for two years
gallery.name: Rocksoc

gallery.description: I went travelling for a year, and I decided I was bored of my old style of realism and wanted to explore a more abstract style of shape and colour.
gallery.name: Abstract

gallery.description: I was employed as a User Experience Designer for Domino Printing Sciences in 2011. I was the first designer this multinational organisation had hired, and my job was to design and create an intuitive, common user interface for all of their printers. I coded the interface using a language called QML, which is part of the Qt UI framework. The interface was for small touchscreens embedded in the industrial printers that the company manufactures.
gallery.name: UI design for Domino
